subsection.name: Description
subsection.div: Requires user defined Javadoc tag to be present in Javadoc comment with defined format. To define the format for a tag, set property tagFormat to a regular expression. Property tagSeverity is used for severity of events when the tag exists. No violation reported in case there is no javadoc.

tr.td: Specify the regexp to match tag content.
Specify the severity level when tag is found and printed.

subset of tokens
INTERFACE_DEF , CLASS_DEF , ENUM_DEF , ANNOTATION_DEF , METHOD_DEF , CTOR_DEF , ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF , ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF , RECORD_DEF , COMPACT_CTOR_DEF .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: Example of default Check configuration that do nothing.
To configure Check to demand some special tag (for example @since) to be present on classes javadoc.
To configure Check to demand some special tag (for example @since) to be present on method javadocs also in addition to default tokens.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="WriteTag"> <property name="tokens" value="INTERFACE_DEF, CLASS_DEF, ENUM_DEF, ANNOTATION_DEF, RECORD_DEF, METHOD_DEF" /> <property name="tag" value="@since"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure Check to demand @since tag to be present with digital value on method javadocs also in addition to default tokens. Attention: it is required to set "ignore" in tagSeverity.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="WriteTag"> <property name="tokens" value="INTERFACE_DEF, CLASS_DEF, ENUM_DEF, ANNOTATION_DEF, RECORD_DEF, METHOD_DEF" /> <property name="tag" value="@since"/> <property name="tagFormat" value="[1-9\.]"/> <property name="tagSeverity" value="ignore"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure Check to demand @since tag and in the same time print violation with specific severity on each presence of such tag.

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="WriteTag"> <property name="tokens" value="INTERFACE_DEF, CLASS_DEF, ENUM_DEF, ANNOTATION_DEF, RECORD_DEF, METHOD_DEF" /> <property name="tag" value="@since"/> <property name="tagFormat" value="[1-9\.]"/> <property name="tagSeverity" value="error"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
